content.name: obama
content.text: From a big NBA fan congrats to future Hall of Famers Dwyane Wade and Dirk Nowitzki—not just all-time greats but class acts too.

content.name: obama
content.text: In just a few minutes I’m taking the stage at the @ObamaFoundation Town Hall Europe for a conversation about how to best support civic leaders carrying out good work across the continent. I hope you’ll tune in live at http://obama.org .https://twitter.com/ObamaFoundation/status/1114516881870872577 …

content.name: obama
content.text: A voice everybody should hear.https://twitter.com/ncaawbb/status/1113842633481310212 …

content.name: obama
content.text: Here’s a story about people doing good that's worth sharing: @BradPaisley and his wife @Kimwilliamspais saw food insecurity in Nashville and decided to do something about it. They just broke ground on a free grocery store to help families in need:https://apnews.com/2f5bdd226a674fd7bd9dca97c172475c …

content.name: obama
content.text: Great to see Chicago’s historic mayoral race between two highly qualified candidates. Congrats to our next mayor Lori Lightfoot—and Toni Preckwinkle campaigned hard and did us proud. I know that with our city’s heart and Lori’s leadership Chicago’s best days are still ahead.

content.name: obama
content.text: Valerie is one of my oldest friends and advisors – she was by my side when I first decided to run for office and for every major moment of the presidency. @ValerieJarrett's voice has often inspired me and I know “Finding My Voice” will inspire others to lift their voices too.pic.twitter.com/nWTBDByMoz

content.name: obama
content.text: Last night I had the chance to meet with first-term Democrats in Congress—it's a young diverse class stocked with a bunch of my campaign and administration alums who’ve taken the torch. This group is going to be driving progress for a long time to come.pic.twitter.com/W5dDlDtNzE

content.name: obama
content.text: Just in the nick of time: My brackets have never been my one shining moment but here we go again. You can check out my #MarchMadness picks here: https://go.obama.org/2019-bracket pic.twitter.com/EcCUdnZjun

content.name: obama
content.text: And here are some ways to help cyclone victims in Mozambique Malawi and Zimbabwe:https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/how-to-help-cyclone-victims-in-mozambique-malawi-and-zimbabwe …

content.name: obama
content.text: The floods in the Midwest and in southern Africa are heartbreaking. Suffering and loss on two sides of the world calls for solidarity and strength from all of us. Ask what you can do to help our fellow Americans and families in need. Here are some ideas:https://www.pbs.org/newshour/nation/how-to-help-those-affected-by-the-midwest-flooding …

content.name: obama
content.text: In 2011 I visited the tiny town of Moneygall and got to walk around in the house where my great-great-great grandfather Falmouth Kearney lived his early life. I'll always be grateful for the warmth and generosity of the Irish people. Happy St. Patrick's Day! -Barack O’Bamapic.twitter.com/abDtarFbR5

content.name: obama
content.text: Michelle and I send our condolences to the people of New Zealand. We grieve with you and the Muslim community. All of us must stand against hatred in all its forms.

content.name: obama
content.text: . @MichelleObama and I are rooting hard for Team USA as the Special Olympics World Games get underway this week. Our Special Olympians are terrific examples of America’s heart and drive.

content.name: obama
content.text: What a great moment. Happy 110th Virginia.https://twitter.com/MichelleObama/status/1105480037271289856 …

content.name: obama
content.text: Michelle and I send our deepest sympathies to all who knew the victims of today’s plane crash in Ethiopia.

content.name: obama
content.text: The Crew Dragon’s been on quite a ride since I last saw it—congrats to @NASA and @SpaceX on a successful return! We invested in the @Commercial_Crew program to strengthen the U.S. space program for the long haul and it’s great to see that happening.pic.twitter.com/Dsu5mZcaCZ

content.name: obama
content.text: Preethi Alice and Sefora are just three of many @ObamaFoundation leaders who remind us what International Women’s Day is all about: imagining a world free of artificial ceilings for the next generation—and doing the hard work to get us there.

content.name: obama
content.text: And @SeforaKodjo is helping the next generation of women leaders in Africa rise up. Her organization is training and mentoring young women across the continent to adopt a new model of leadership one that puts gender equality at the heart of economic development.pic.twitter.com/cRb4EKcrvv

content.name: obama
content.text: . @BarbeAlice is helping refugees resettle into welcoming communities in France offering them job training and language immersion as well as a place to stay. More importantly she’s fighting a narrative that suggests our differences are more important than our shared humanity.pic.twitter.com/jNIiKIAZaO

content.name: obama
content.text: . @preethiherman is helping women unleash their power to change their societies. As head of the http://Change.org  Foundation she’s leading an initiative that combines online tools with in-person organizing giving women a voice in her native India—and beyond.pic.twitter.com/TKuAKVL5Y1

content.name: obama
content.text: On International Women’s Day I’m reflecting on the future we all want for our daughters: one where they can live out their aspirations without limits. And I’m celebrating some of the women who are building that future for all of us today.

content.name: obama
content.text: It’s up to all of us as citizens to make sure that the rules of democracy are fair—everywhere—because the next decade of our nation's progress is on the line. Join me and @allontheline in the fight against gerrymandering: http://allontheline.org .pic.twitter.com/rKchS3ltLI

content.name: obama
content.text: Zion Williamson seems like an outstanding young man as well as an outstanding basketball player. Wishing him a speedy recovery.

content.name: obama
content.text: I’m about to join @StephenCurry30 on stage with @MBK_Alliance to answer questions from boys and young men of color about the challenges that confront them and the opportunities within their grasp. Tune in at http://obama.org .

content.name: obama
content.text: I’ve always loved basketball because it’s about building a team that’s equal to more than the sum of its parts. Glad to see this expansion into Africa because for a rising continent this can be about a lot more than what happens on the court.https://twitter.com/NBA/status/1096862836989534208 …

content.name: obama
content.text: Happy Valentine’s Day to the extraordinarily smart beautiful funny one and only @MichelleObama. It’s true; she does get down to Motown.pic.twitter.com/uypbZsEiqB

content.name: obama
content.text: In the year since their friends were killed the students of Parkland refused to settle for the way things are and marched organized and pushed for the way things should be - helping pass meaningful new gun violence laws in states across the country. I'm proud of all of them.

content.name: obama
content.text: Don’t be sad it’s over be proud it taught us so much. Congrats to all the men and women of @NASA on a @MarsRovers mission that beat all expectations inspired a new generation of Americans and demands we keep investing in science that pushes the boundaries of human knowledge.

content.name: obama
content.text: Happy 85th birthday to @RealBillRussell - the greatest champion in American sports and a lifelong warrior for justice.

content.name: obama
content.text: My statement on the passing of former Congressman John Dingell:pic.twitter.com/gjBYHHImzB

content.name: obama
content.text: We lost two great Americans today – Frank Robinson and John Dingell – citizens who inspired me and so many others by leading on the civil rights issues of our time opening doors to others and leaving it all on the field.

content.name: obama
content.text: As we celebrate Black History Month and Jackie Robinson’s 100th birthday we celebrate the life of all whose courage opened the gates for everybody and in the process made America better.pic.twitter.com/Fl9aDxqcGi

content.name: obama
content.text: The @ObamaFoundation is connecting people from around the world so they can form partnerships just like this. I am inspired by Robert and Vanessa and what’s possible when leaders come together to have an even greater impact on the world.https://twitter.com/ObamaFoundation/status/1088839648665833472 …

content.name: obama
content.text: I’ve always drawn inspiration from what Dr. King called life’s most persistent and urgent question: "What are you doing for others?" Let’s honor his legacy by standing up for what is right in our communities and taking steps to make a positive impact on the world.

content.name: obama
content.text: I knew it way back then and I’m absolutely convinced of it today — you’re one of a kind @MichelleObama. Happy Birthday!pic.twitter.com/ejqm0uC9J4

content.name: obama
content.text: In 2018 people stepped up and showed up like never before. Keep it up in 2019. We’ve got a lot of work to do and I’ll be right there with you. Happy New Year everybody!

content.name: obama
content.text: I hope you find inspiration in the stories of Dejah Moussa Sandor Hong and Jonny. Their journeys began with a decision to build the better future they wanted to see. The same is true for you. What matters isn’t the size of the step you take; what matters is that you take it.

content.name: obama
content.text: Leaders like Jonny Boucher a Chicago native who after losing too many friends and family to suicide started a coffee shop to offer emotional support and guidance to those who might be in need of a little more than a strong cup of coffee to get through their day.pic.twitter.com/H6XPceR6d9

content.name: obama
content.text: Leaders like Hong Hoang who mobilized a youth-led movement to create a greener world after becoming the first Vietnamese person to visit Antarctica. https://www.obama.org/photo-essay-hoang/ …

content.name: obama
content.text: Leaders like Moussa Kondo and Sandor Lederer who are each doing their part to fight corruption in their native countries of Mali and Hungary. Two people separated by continents but united in their pursuit of a more just transparent society.https://www.obama.org/fellowship/moussa-kondo-sandor-lederer/ …

content.name: obama
content.text: Leaders like Dejah Powell who started an organization to bring health and wellness resources to communities on the South Side of Chicago expanding food access and providing people the space and time to take care of themselves.pic.twitter.com/tPW7NxTGLO

content.name: obama
content.text: As the year winds down and we look toward 2019 I’m asking you to make a commitment: find something you want to change in your community and take the first step toward changing it. If you need some inspiration take a look at some of the young leaders who inspired me this year.

content.name: obama
content.text: As 2018 draws to a close I’m continuing the tradition of sharing my year-end lists. It gives me a moment to reflect on the year through the books movies and music that I found most thought-provoking inspiring or just plain loved. I hope you enjoy it: https://www.facebook.com/barackobama/posts/10156393283416749 …

content.name: obama
content.text: Enjoy the holiday season with the ones you love. Michelle and I wish you a very Merry Christmas!pic.twitter.com/LKLqlYfFUw

content.name: obama
content.text: There’s no better time than the holidays to give back to your community. Yesterday I got to do just that at @ChildrensHealth. As we celebrate the season and look forward to 2019 let’s recommit to doing our part to build a world that is a little more generous tolerant and kind.https://twitter.com/ObamaFoundation/status/1075852828118269952 …

content.name: obama
content.text: Merry Christmas and happy holidays to the extraordinary kids families and staff at Children’s National. And thanks for humoring me as your stand-in Santa.https://twitter.com/childrenshealth/status/1075507032537620480 …

content.name: obama
content.text: Today is the last day of open enrollment. That means it’s the deadline to make sure you and the people you love have health insurance in 2019. So head over to http://HealthCare.gov  to get covered! Here’s what else you need to know today about health care:pic.twitter.com/gosn6c6uCa

content.name: obama
content.text: Joe is right. Head to http://healthcare.gov  before tomorrow’s deadline. And nice bracelet by the way.https://twitter.com/JoeBiden/status/1073716529336860673 …

content.name: obama
content.text: As Bobby Kennedy taught us the thing about hope is that it travels through space *and* time first splashing against the rocks but eventually breaking down the walls of cruelty and injustice. And if we do our best with the time we’re given others will take hope in our example.https://twitter.com/RFKHumanRights/status/1073054288400801792 …

content.name: obama
content.text: No jump shots. No ferns. No memes. Not this time. I’m going to give it to you straight: If you need health insurance for 2019 the deadline to get covered is December 15. Go to http://HealthCare.gov  today and pass this on — you just might save a life.pic.twitter.com/8mHMsXGY0g

content.name: obama
content.text: Happy Hanukkah! Over these eight nights we draw inspiration from light that can overpower any darkness and recommit ourselves to building a brighter future for our families our communities and our world. Chag Sameach from the Obama family to yours.

content.name: obama
content.text: America has lost a patriot and humble servant in George Herbert Walker Bush. While our hearts are heavy today they are also filled with gratitude. Our thoughts are with the entire Bush family tonight – and all who were inspired by George and Barbara’s example.pic.twitter.com/g9OUPu2pjY

content.name: obama
content.text: I am grateful for the next generation of leaders -- the young people who are tolerant creative idealistic and doing the work to create the world as it should be. Who understand that hope requires action. From the Obama family to yours Happy Thanksgiving.https://twitter.com/ObamaFoundation/status/1065309361906561025 …

content.name: obama
content.text: Thanks to the Chicago @FoodDepository team for all you do and to the volunteers who are doing great work and let me crash today. Happy Thanksgiving everybody!https://twitter.com/FoodDepository/status/1065001878352740353 …

content.name: obama
content.text: When someone shares their story we see the world through their eyes. I’m looking forward to hearing a few from leaders around the world and sharing my own at the @ObamaFoundation Summit in Chicago. Tune in at http://Obama.org .pic.twitter.com/sOllDsDA1Z

content.name: obama
content.text: Our future depends on all our young people including our boys and young men of color being able to achieve their dreams. Today I’m proud to share @MBK_Alliance’s first investments in communities devoted to this mission. Get inspired:http://obama.org/MBKA/communities …

content.name: obama
content.text: Of course @MichelleObama’s my wife so I’m a little biased here. But she also happens to be brilliant funny wise – one of a kind. This book tells her quintessentially American story. I love it because it faithfully reflects the woman I have loved for so long.pic.twitter.com/X0i9jja4TE

content.name: obama
content.text: Michelle and I are heartbroken for everybody who’s lost so much in California and grateful for the heroism of the firefighters who’ve been risking their lives around the clock to save others. Please do what you can to help our fellow Americans in need:https://nyti.ms/2DdQB3c

content.name: obama
content.text: To all our veterans and your families: thank you. There's no tribute that can truly match the magnitude of your service and sacrifice. But all of us can do our best to live up to the American values of service responsibility generosity and citizenship that you helped defend.

content.name: obama
content.text: Congratulations to everybody who showed up and participated in our democracy in record numbers yesterday. The change we need won’t come from one election alone – but it is a start. Last night voters across the country started it.pic.twitter.com/gNk4WkeJUn

content.name: obama
content.text: Today is the day. Today it’s your turn to raise your voice to change the course of this country for the better. So make it count. Get out there and vote. Go to http://IWillVote.com  or call 833-336-VOTE to confirm where you can vote and check voting hours.pic.twitter.com/6xdMbKhwkr

content.name: obama
content.text: If you take that power and vote something powerful happens. Change happens. Hope happens. And with each new step we take in the direction of fairness and justice and equality and opportunity hope spreads. Go vote!http://IWillVote.com

content.name: obama
content.text: When you vote you have the power to make it easier for a student to afford college and harder for a disturbed person to shoot up a classroom. When you vote you have the power to make sure a family keeps its health insurance.

content.name: obama
content.text: When you vote you have the power to protect voting rights. To make sure our criminal justice system treats everyone equally under the law. To strengthen laws that protect women in the workplace from harassment – and make sure they’re paid equally.

content.name: obama
content.text: When we've been at such crossroads before Americans have made the right choice. Not because we sat back and waited for history to happen -- but because we marched and mobilized and voted. We made history happen.

content.name: obama
content.text: Tomorrow’s elections might be the most important of our lifetimes. The health care of millions is on the ballot. Making sure working families get a fair shake is on the ballot. The character of our country is on the ballot.

content.name: obama
content.text: Speaking of preexisting conditions open enrollment starts today. If you or someone you know needs health care visit http://HealthCare.gov . Thanks to financial help most people can find plans for $75/month or less so check out your options and find a plan that works for you.pic.twitter.com/R52X9sgkbP

content.name: obama
content.text: Elections matter. You have the power to protect a family’s health care. Make a plan grab some friends and vote: https://iwillvote.com

content.name: obama
content.text: While we're talking about preexisting conditions the ACA is the law that finally protected your coverage for preexisting conditions. Those protections and your health care are absolutely at stake on Tuesday. Vote for Democrats who’ll protect them.https://www.thecut.com/2018/10/republicans-dont-protect-preexisting-conditions.html …

content.name: obama
content.text: Not sure who and what you can vote for? Head over to http://votesaveamerica.com/ballot  to look up your state learn who's running to represent you which measures you can help decide and more. Read up and get ready to vote on November 6.

content.name: obama
content.text: Your vote can decide the health care of millions. Your voice can determine the character of our country. You have power — use it! In most states you don't even have to wait until Election Day to cast a ballot. Find out where you can vote before Nov. 6: http://IWillVote.com pic.twitter.com/hWkFHqi49K

content.name: obama
content.text: We grieve for the Americans murdered in Pittsburgh. All of us have to fight the rise of anti-Semitism and hateful rhetoric against those who look love or pray differently. And we have to stop making it so easy for those who want to harm the innocent to get their hands on a gun.

content.name: obama
content.text: The last presidential election turned on fewer than 100000 votes in three states. More people go to Coachella. There’s no good excuse not to vote. Head over to http://Vote.org  to check your registration get your absentee ballot and find out where to vote on November 6.https://twitter.com/attn/status/1052577837968846848 …

content.name: obama
content.text: America is always at our best when we look out for each other. Please do what you can to help people recover and rebuild from Hurricane Michael.https://www.charitynavigator.org/index.cfm?bay=content.view&cpid=6806 …

content.name: obama
content.text: I’m so proud of the work @MichelleObama has done over the years to ensure adolescent girls have access to education and I know that the @GirlsAlliance will be another great chapter in her effort to get girls the opportunities they deserve.https://twitter.com/girlsalliance/status/1050358965702414336 …

content.name: obama
content.text: Congratulations to Drew Brees on the all time passing record. Always a class act.

content.name: obama
content.text: Happy Anniversary @MichelleObama. For 26 years you’ve been an extraordinary partner someone who can always make me laugh and my favorite person to see the world with.pic.twitter.com/s8xoZ9j2YR

content.name: obama
content.text: Today I’m proud to endorse even more Democratic candidates who aren’t just running against something but for something—to expand opportunity for all of us and to restore dignity honor and compassion to public service. They deserve your vote:pic.twitter.com/NO5jnhX3XD

content.name: obama
content.text: From civil servants to organizers the young people I met in Amsterdam today are doing the hard work of change. And they keep at it for their communities their countries and the collective future of Europe and the world. Keep up the good work.pic.twitter.com/AVtuBPHdr2

content.name: obama
content.text: The antidote to government by a powerful few is government by the organized energized many. This National Voter Registration Day make sure you're registered vote early if you can or show up on November 6. This moment is too important to sit out.

content.name: obama
content.text: The first class of Obama Fellows is full of leaders like Keith—hardworking innovative and dedicated to partnering with their communities to drive transformational change.https://twitter.com/ObamaFoundation/status/1040634794764320773 …

content.name: obama
content.text: We will always remember everyone we lost on 9/11 thank the first responders who keep us safe and honor all who defend our country and the ideals that bind us together. There's nothing our resilience and resolve can’t overcome and no act of terror can ever change who we are.

content.name: obama
content.text: Today I’m at the University of Illinois to deliver a simple message to young people all over the country: You need to vote because our democracy depends on it. I hope you'll tune in at 11am CT: http://go.illinois.edu/live

content.name: obama
content.text: Yesterday I met with high school students on Chicago’s Southwest side who spent the summer learning to code some pretty cool apps. Michelle and I are proud to support programs that invest in local youth and we’re proud of these young people.pic.twitter.com/dQnDgswCj5

content.name: obama
content.text: Congratulations to Hawaii for winning the Little League World Series! You make America very proud. https://twitter.com/LittleLeague/status/1033829386116640773 …

content.name: obama
content.text: Our statement on the passing of Senator John McCain:pic.twitter.com/3GBjNYxoj5

content.name: obama
content.text: Aretha helped define the American experience. In her voice we could feel our history all of it and in every shade—our power and our pain our darkness and our light our quest for redemption and our hard-won respect. May the Queen of Soul rest in eternal peace.pic.twitter.com/bfASqKlLc5

content.name: obama
content.text: Bobby Kennedy was one of my heroes. He was someone who showed us the power of acting on our ideals the idea that any of us can be one of the “million different centers of energy and daring” that ultimately combine to change the world for the better.https://twitter.com/RFKHumanRights/status/1026456623311716354 …

content.name: obama
content.text: I’m confident that together they’ll strengthen this country we love by restoring opportunity repairing our alliances and standing in the world and upholding our fundamental commitment to justice fairness responsibility and the rule of law. But first they need our votes.

content.name: obama
content.text: Today I’m proud to endorse such a wide and impressive array of Democratic candidates – leaders as diverse patriotic and big-hearted as the America they’re running to represent:pic.twitter.com/gWzalQhFas

content.name: obama
content.text: Mandela Day is about taking action to change the world for the better. In these young people I see Madiba's example of persistence and hope. They are poised to make this world more peaceful more prosperous and more just.pic.twitter.com/GJDuOs1hkH

content.name: obama
content.text: This week I’m traveling to Africa for the first time since I left office – a continent of wonderful diversity thriving culture and remarkable stories. As I prepare for this trip I wanted to share a list of books that I’d recommend for summer reading: https://www.facebook.com/barackobama/posts/10156007456406749 …

content.name: obama
content.text: Congratulations to the @Capitals! This @NHLBlackhawks fan knows what it’s like to lift that cup – and I’m happy for all the Caps fans who cheer so hard for their team and for a team that celebrates so hard with its fans.

content.name: obama
content.text: “Low plastic stool cheap but delicious noodles cold Hanoi beer.” This is how I’ll remember Tony. He taught us about food — but more importantly about its ability to bring us together. To make us a little less afraid of the unknown. We’ll miss him.pic.twitter.com/orEXIaEMZM

content.name: obama
content.text: This National Gun Violence Awareness Day show your commitment to keeping our kids safe from gun violence. Then for everyone we’ve lost take action to change our leadership and our laws until they reflect that commitment - no matter how long it takes.https://twitter.com/ofa/status/1002554110519009280 …

content.name: obama
content.text: We can never truly repay the debt we owe our fallen heroes. But we can remember them honor their sacrifice and affirm in our own lives those enduring ideals of justice equality and opportunity for which generations of Americans have given that last full measure of devotion.pic.twitter.com/pRxwmaMClL

content.name: obama
content.text: This Center is for the leaders of tomorrow who are ready to step up and build the world as it should be. Michelle and I are grateful to Chicagoans and the Chicago City Council for making it happen.http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/obamacenter/ct-met-city-council-obama-pres-dential-center-20180523-story.html …

content.name: obama
content.text: Happy Mother’s Day to every mom out there especially the remarkable moms in my life @MichelleObama and my mother-in-law Marian Robinson.pic.twitter.com/n65fyWg7O8

content.name: obama
content.text: There are few issues more important to the security of the US than the potential spread of nuclear weapons or the potential for even more destructive war in the Middle East. Today’s decision to put the JCPOA at risk is a serious mistake. My full statement: https://www.facebook.com/barackobama/posts/10155854913976749 …

content.name: obama
content.text: These talented young people will create a better future not just in Africa but around the world. I can’t wait to spend some time with @ObamaFoundation Leaders and look forward to honoring the Mandela legacy in Johannesburg this summer.https://twitter.com/obamafoundation/status/988475935463759878 …

content.name: obama
content.text: Our statement on the passing of Former First Lady Barbara Bush:pic.twitter.com/MhTVYCL9Nj

content.name: obama
content.text: Incredible to have a Chicago team in the Final Four. I’ll take that over an intact bracket any day! Congratulations to everybody @LoyolaChicago - let’s keep it going!

content.name: obama
content.text: Michelle and I are so inspired by all the young people who made today’s marches happen. Keep at it. You’re leading us forward. Nothing can stand in the way of millions of voices calling for change.

content.name: obama
content.text: Our most important task as a nation is to make sure all our young people can achieve their dreams. We’ve started this work with @MBK_Alliance but there’s so much more all of us have to do—government private sector academia & community leaders—to change the odds for our kids.https://twitter.com/upshotnyt/status/975774912764882946 …

content.name: obama
content.text: In Singapore with young people who are advocating for education empowering young women and getting involved all over Southeast Asia with a profoundly optimistic commitment to building the world they want to see.https://twitter.com/ganeshmuren/status/975711729609920512 …

content.name: obama
content.text: 41: I like the competition. And the loyalty to the home team. - 44https://twitter.com/georgehwbush/status/974345353322483713 …

content.name: obama
content.text: Congrats to @LoyolaChicago and Sister Jean for a last-second upset - I had faith in my pick!

content.name: obama
content.text: Just because I have more time to watch games doesn’t mean my picks will be better but here are my brackets this year: https://go.obama.org/2018bracket pic.twitter.com/gnNXw0Ysxr

content.name: obama
content.text: Have fun out there among the stars.pic.twitter.com/S285MTwGtp

content.name: obama
content.text: Four years ago @MichelleObama and I had the privilege to host Lt. Cmdr. Dan Cnossen and his fellow Paralympians and Olympians at the White House. Today we’re so proud of him for winning gold and silver - while still representing the red white and blue.pic.twitter.com/evDCV7zehM

content.name: obama
content.text: I got my start holding community meetings in Chicago so it was fun to be home for one tonight. Michelle and I want the world to come together on the South Side at a place built with local ideas values and hopes. That’s the @ObamaFoundation and Presidential Center.https://twitter.com/obamafoundation/status/968681134480674817 …

content.name: obama
content.text: Young people have helped lead all our great movements. How inspiring to see it again in so many smart fearless students standing up for their right to be safe; marching and organizing to remake the world as it should be. We've been waiting for you. And we've got your backs.

content.name: obama
content.text: Billy Graham was a humble servant who prayed for so many - and who with wisdom and grace gave hope and guidance to generations of Americans.

content.name: obama
content.text: We are grieving with Parkland. But we are not powerless. Caring for our kids is our first job. And until we can honestly say that we're doing enough to keep them safe from harm including long overdue common-sense gun safety laws that most Americans want then we have to change.

content.text: Dr. King was 26 when the Montgomery bus boycott began. He started small rallying others who believed their efforts mattered pressing on through challenges and doubts to change our world for the better. A permanent inspiration for the rest of us to keep pushing towards justice.

content.name: obama
content.text: All across America people chose to get involved get engaged and stand up. Each of us can make a difference and all of us ought to try. So go keep changing the world in 2018.

content.name: obama
content.text: Ten-year-old Jahkil Jackson is on a mission to help homeless people in Chicago. He created kits full of socks toiletries and food for those in need. Just this week Jahkil reached his goal to give away 5000 “blessing bags.” That’s a story from 2017.http://www.chicagotribune.com/lifestyles/stevens/ct-life-stevens-wednesday-10-year-old-helps-homeless-0927-story.html …

content.name: obama
content.text: Chris Long gave his paychecks from the first six games of the NFL season to fund scholarships in Charlottesville VA. He wanted to do more so he decided to give away an entire season’s salary. That’s a story from 2017.http://www.philly.com/philly/sports/eagles/philadelphia-eagles-chris-long-donated-paychecks-charity-20171019.html …

content.text: Kat Creech a wedding planner in Houston turned a postponed wedding into a volunteer opportunity for Hurricane Harvey victims. content.text: As we count down to the new year we get to reflect and prepare for what’s ahead. For all the bad news that seemed to dominate our collective consciousness there are countless stories from this year that remind us what's best about America.

content.text: I believe in change because I believe in you. —President Obama #SOTU

content.text: I can promise that a year from now when I no longer hold this office I’ll be right there with you as a citizen. —President Obama #SOTU

content.text: It is surely the pursuit of peace that is most needed in this world so full of strife. —President Obama #IranDeal

content.name: obama
content.text:
As members of Congress reflect on their pending decision I urge them to set aside political considerations.” —President Obama #IranDeal,https://twitter.com/BarackObama/status/628973664990433280,367,1044,
2015/08/05_09:58,https://twitter.com/BarackObama,As Americans we should be proud of this achievement." —President Obama #IranDeal

content.name: obama
content.text: Now we have before us a solution that prevents Iran from obtaining a nuclear weapon without resorting to war. —President Obama #IranDeal

content.name: obama
content.text:
President Kennedy warned Americans not to see conflict as inevitable. It is time to apply such wisdom.” —President Obama #IranDeal,https://twitter.com/BarackObama/status/628972310561558528,1073,1848,
2015/08/05_09:53,https://twitter.com/BarackObama,I have repeatedly challenged anyone opposed to this deal to put forward a better plausible alternative." —President Obama #IranDeal

content.name: obama
content.text:
When we carefully examine the arguments against this deal none of them stand up to scrutiny.” —President Obama #IranDeal,https://twitter.com/BarackObama/status/628971616651776000,385,933,
2015/08/05_09:49,https://twitter.com/BarackObama,If Iran violates this deal we will have ample opportunity to respond." —President Obama #IranDeal

content.name: obama
content.text:
Worry less about being labeled weak. Worry more about getting it right.” —President Obama #IranDeal,https://twitter.com/BarackObama/status/628970659041816577,1412,2250,
2015/08/05_09:46,https://twitter.com/BarackObama,How can we in good conscience justify war before we have tested a diplomatic agreement that achieves our objectives?" —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: “The choice we face is ultimately between diplomacy or some sort of war.” —President Obama #IranDeal

content.name: obama
content.text: “Walk away from this agreement and you will get a better deal—for Iran.” —President Obama #IranDeal

content.name: obama
content.text: “Those who say we can walk away from this deal and maintain sanctions are selling a fantasy.” —President Obama #IranDeal

content.name: obama
content.text: We will continue to have sanctions in place on Iran's support for terrorism and violation of human rights.—President Obama #IranDeal

content.name: obama
content.text: “There is no scenario where sanctions relief turns Iran into the region's dominate power.” —President Obama #IranDeal

content.name: obama
content.text: “An argument against sanctions relief is effectively an argument against any diplomatic solution.” —President Obama #IranDeal

content.name: obama
content.text: Without this deal the scenarios that critics warn about happening in 15 years could happen six months from now. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: The bottom line is if Iran cheats we can catch them—and we will. —President Obama #IranDeal

content.name: obama
content.text: “This deal is not just the best choice among alternatives—this is the strongest non-proliferation agreement ever.” —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: “If Iran violates the agreement over the next decade all of the sanctions can snap back in to place.” —President Obama #IranDeal

content.name: obama
content.text: Iran has powerful incentives to keep its commitments. —President Obama #IranDeal

content.name: obama
content.text:
This deal shuts off the type of covert program Iran has pursued in the past.” —President Obama #IranDeal,https://twitter.com/BarackObama/status/628966157706354688,340,679,
2015/08/05_09:27,https://twitter.com/BarackObama,In July we reached a comprehensive plan of action that meets our objectives." —President Obama #IranDeal

content.name: obama
content.text: What was once proclaimed as a historic mistake is now held up as a success. —President Obama #IranDeal

content.name: obama
content.text: “The progress of Iran's nuclear program was halted for the first time in a decade.” —President Obama #IranDeal

content.name: obama
content.text: It was diplomacy that ratcheted up the pressure on Iran. —President Obama #IranDeal

content.name: obama
content.text: Winning this global buy-in was not easy. I know. I was there. —President Obama #IranDeal

content.name: obama
content.text: What made our new approach more effective was our ability to draw upon new U.N. Security Council resolutions. —President Obama #IranDeal

content.name: obama
content.text: “It was our very willingness to negotiate that helped America rally the world to our cause.” —President Obama #IranDeal

content.name: obama
content.text: I have also made clear my preference for a peaceful diplomatic resolution of the issue. —President Obama #IranDeal

content.name: obama
content.text: Even before taking office I made clear that Iran would not be allowed to acquire a nuclear weapon on my watch. —President Obama #IranDeal

content.name: obama
content.text: The question then is not whether to prevent Iran from obtaining a nuclear weapon but how. —President Obama #IranDeal

content.name: obama
content.text: Now more than ever we need clear thinking in our foreign policy. —President Obama #IranDeal

content.name: obama
content.text: “More than a decade later we still live with the consequences of the decision to invade Iraq.” —President Obama #IranDeal

content.name: obama
content.text: If we keep taking steps toward a more perfect union ... America will move forward. There's nothing we can't do. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: We cannot ignore the problems that we have but we can't stop running the race. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: We are not perfect but we have the capacity to be more perfect—mile after mile step after step. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: Justice and redemption go hand in hand. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: Justice is living up to the common creed that I am my brother's keeper and I am my sister's keeper. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: Justice is making sure that every young person knows that they are special and their lives matter. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: Justice is not only the absence of oppression—it is the presence of opportunity. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: Let's reward prisoners with reduced sentences if they complete programs that make them less likely to repeat an offense. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: I've asked my Attorney General to start a review of the overuse of solitary confinement in our federal prisons. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: We should not tolerate conditions in prison that have no place in any civilized country. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: On Thursday I will be the first sitting president to visit a federal prison. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: We should pass a sentencing reform bill through congress this year. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: For nonviolent drug crimes we need to lower long mandatory minimum sentences—or get rid of them entirely. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: Don't just tag them as future criminals. Reach out to them as future citizens. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: We have to restore trust between our police and some of the communities where they serve. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: We gotta make sure boys and girls in those communities are loved and cherished and nurtured and invested in. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: What doesn't make sense is treating entire neighborhoods as danger zones. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: We recognize that every child deserves opportunity. Not just some. Not just our own. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: One study found that for every dollar we invest in Pre-K we save at least twice that in reduced crime. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: If we make investments early in our children we will reduce the need to incarcerate those kids. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: I believe crime is like any other epidemic—we need to stop it before it starts. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: For the first time in 40 years America's crime rate and incarceration rate went down at the same time. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: This is a cause that is bringing people in both houses of Congress together. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: Mass incarceration makes our country worse off—and we need to do something about it. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: Our criminal justice system isn't as smart as it should be. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: Our nation is being robbed of men and women who could be workers and taxpayers. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: Around one million fathers are behind bars. Around one in nine African-American kids has a parent in prison. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: African Americans are more likely to be arrested. They are more likely to be sentenced to more time for the same crime. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: A growing body of research shows that people of color are more likely to be frisked stopped questioned detained. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: African Americans and Latinos make up 30 percent of our population. They make up 60 percent of our inmates. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: Roughly one-third of the Justice Department's budget now goes toward incarceration. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: For $80 billion we could double the salary of every high school teacher in America. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: Every year we spend $80 billion to keep those folks incarcerated. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: In far too many cases the punishment does not fit the crime. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: Over the last few decades we've locked up more and more nonviolent drug offenders for longer than ever before. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: If we're going to deal with this problem and the inequities involved we're going to have to speak honestly. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: Our prison population has doubled in the last two decades alone. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: In 1980 there were 500000 people behind bars in America ... Today there are 2.2 million. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: The United States is home to 5 percent of the world's population but 25 percent of the world's prisoners. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: In too many cases our criminal justice system becomes a pipeline from underfunded schools to overcrowded jails. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: There is a long history of inequity in the criminal justice system in America. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: We can't be satisfied—are not satisfied—until the opportunity gap is closed for everybody in America. —President Obama #NAACP106

content.name: obama
content.text: Health care is not a privilege for the few but a right for all of us. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: We made progress but our work is not done. —President Obama #NAACP106

content.name: obama
content.text: I would not be here and so many others would not be here without the NAACP. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: Let's get something out of the way up front: I am not singing today. —President Obama

content.text: We honor those who walked so we could run. We must run so our children soar. —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn

content.name: obama
content.text: Thank you God Bless you and may He forever bless these United States of America.

content.name: obama
content.text: Let us answer the call of history and carry into an uncertain future that precious light of freedom. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: You and I as citizens have the obligation to shape the debates of our time.

content.name: obama
content.text: You and I as citizens have the power to set this country’s course.

content.name: obama
content.text: We must act knowing that our work will be imperfect. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: We cannot mistake absolutism for principle or substitute spectacle for politics or treat name-calling as reasoned debate.

content.name: obama
content.text: Decisions are upon us and we cannot afford delay.

content.name: obama
content.text: Our journey is not complete until all our children know that they are cared for and cherished and always safe from harm.

content.name: obama
content.text: Our journey is not complete until we find a better way to welcome the immigrants who still see America as a land of opportunity.

content.name: obama
content.text: Our journey is not complete until no citizen is forced to wait for hours to exercise the right to vote.

content.name: obama
content.text: Our journey is not complete until our gay brothers and sisters are treated like anyone else under the law.

content.name: obama
content.text: Our journey is not complete until our wives our mothers and daughters can earn a living equal to their efforts.

content.name: obama
content.text: We the people declare today that the most evident of truths—that all of us are created equal—is the star that guides us still.

content.name: obama
content.text: We will show the courage to try and resolve our differences with other nations peacefully.

content.name: obama
content.text: We will defend our people and uphold our values through strength of arms and rule of law. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: We the people still believe that enduring security and lasting peace do not require perpetual war.

content.name: obama
content.text: We will respond to the threat of climate change knowing that the failure to do so would betray our children and future generations.

content.name: obama
content.text: We the people still believe that our obligations as Americans are not just to ourselves but to all posterity.

content.name: obama
content.text: We do not believe that in this country freedom is reserved for the lucky or happiness for the few.

content.name: obama
content.text: We the people still believe that every citizen deserves a basic measure of security and dignity. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: We the people understand that our country cannot succeed when a shrinking few do very well and a growing many barely make it.

content.name: obama
content.text: We are made for this moment and we will seize it—so long as we seize it together. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: America’s possibilities are limitless for we possess all the qualities that this world without boundaries demands. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: A decade of war is now ending. An economic recovery has begun. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: This generation of Americans has been tested by crises that steeled our resolve and proved our resilience. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: Now more than ever we must do these things together as one nation and one people. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: We have always understood that when times change so must we. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: Together we resolved that a great nation must care for the vulnerable and protect its people from life’s worst hazards and misfortune.

content.name: obama
content.text: We made ourselves anew and vowed to move forward together. —President Obama

content.name: obama
content.text: Each time we gather to inaugurate a president we bear witness to the enduring strength of our Constitution. —President Obama
